security_audit.summary: This skill contains only documentation and Python utility scripts for risk/vulnerability management. The scripts process local CSV files with standard library only. No network calls, no external commands, no sensitive data access. Purely educational and operational content for security professionals.

content.user_title: Implement security architecture and compliance frameworks
content.value_statement: Security professionals need comprehensive guidance on implementing defense-in-depth architectures and achieving compliance certifications. This skill provides actionable frameworks, tools, and templates for SOC 2, ISO 27001, GDPR, HIPAA, risk assessment, and incident response.
actual_capabilities: Guide implementation of Zero Trust and defense-in-depth security architectures
Provide step-by-step SOC 2 Type II compliance roadmap and control templates
Support ISO 27001, GDPR, HIPAA, and PCI-DSS framework implementation
Run risk assessment calculations using SLE, ALE, and qualitative risk matrices
Prioritize vulnerabilities using CVSS scores with business context factors
Provide incident response playbooks and post-incident review templates
limitations: Scripts only process local CSV files; does not connect to external systems
Does not perform actual security scanning or penetration testing
Does not provide legal advice on compliance requirements
Templates require customization for specific organizational contexts

use_cases.title: Design Security Architecture

use_cases.title: Achieve SOC 2 Certification

use_cases.title: Respond to Security Incidents

prompt_templates.title: Risk Assessment
prompt_templates.scenario: I need to assess organizational risk

prompt_templates.title: Architecture
prompt_templates.scenario: I need to design security controls

prompt_templates.title: Incident Response
prompt_templates.scenario: I need to respond to a security incident
prompt_templates.prompt: My organization detected a ransomware attack. Walk me through the incident response lifecycle including containment, eradication, and recovery steps.

best_practices: Apply defense in depth with multiple security layers so single-point failures do not compromise security
Automate evidence collection for compliance audits to reduce manual effort and ensure consistency
Conduct regular tabletop exercises to test incident response procedures before real incidents occur
anti_patterns: Relying on a single security control without backup defenses or compensating controls
Delaying vulnerability patches more than SLA allows, especially for internet-facing systems
Skipping post-incident reviews after security events, missing opportunities to improve

faq.question: Which compliance framework should I start with?
faq.answer: SOC 2 is typically best for SaaS companies selling to enterprises. ISO 27001 provides broader international recognition.

faq.question: How long does SOC 2 Type II certification take?
faq.answer: Plan for 6-8 months total: 3 months preparation, 3-6 months observation period, 1-2 months for audit fieldwork.

faq.question: Can I use these scripts in production?
faq.answer: The scripts are for analysis and reporting. Review outputs before acting. Not a substitute for professional security assessment.

faq.question: Is my data sent anywhere when running the scripts?
faq.answer: No. The Python scripts only read local CSV files and write output locally. No network calls or external communications.

faq.question: What risk assessment methodologies are supported?
faq.answer: Quantitative (SLE, ALE calculations) and qualitative (risk matrix 5√ó5 likelihood√óimpact) methodologies are implemented.

faq.question: How does this skill compare to hiring a consultant?
faq.answer: This skill provides frameworks and templates to support your security program. Complex audits and implementations still benefit from expert guidance.
